column4: I need help! ubuntu minimal CD install doesn't detect either LAN or wifi... is that normal?
I've checked the LAN, it is up
i had an issue in minimal where it wouldn't see either of my NICs on an EEE 1005
there was a different result using 10.04LTS vs 10.10 BTW
really? it's weird, I guess I'm going to stick with mandriva then (last version is more recent than ubuntu 10.04)... at least the minimal install works there :/
I was using 11.04, was it what you tried too?
i've never used 11.04 (10.04LTS is the last Ubuntu I'll ever use, i've switched distros now)
because of experimenting with Minimal actually - led me to Debian

well what I was looking for with minimal is an install that allowed me to only download the packages I need - I happen to live in one of the three places on earth where internet connection is billed by the gigabyte
FYI the ubuntu minimal install is basically a Debian Netinstall, only using ubuntu repos.
have you tried "pasuspender mugen" if mugen is the executable name?
I just tried, doesn't work... looks like these suspenders made the trousers fall as well
there's a post in ubuntuforums that suggests trying "alsamixer" and enabling everything.  I got nothing, best of luck.
I don't have much in there
I have master, pcm, s/pdif and beep in alsamixer, master and pcm are 100%, I can't do anything with S/PDIF and honestly I don't think beep can have an effect...
sorry, i have no idea.  good luck.
